comments.text:
https://litmus.mozilla.org/show_test.cgi?id=11331

Given the test case above, it appears as though HTTPS framesets should display a "Secure Connection Failed" error page.  However, the test does not display this error page; it just loads the content.

Can I get any feedback on whether this testcase is valid anymore? In other words, should HTTPS framesets continue to display an error page?
comments.raw_text:
https://litmus.mozilla.org/show_test.cgi?id=11331

Given the test case above, it appears as though HTTPS framesets should display a "Secure Connection Failed" error page.  However, the test does not display this error page; it just loads the content.

Can I get any feedback on whether this testcase is valid anymore? In other words, should HTTPS framesets continue to display an error page?
comments.creator: u279076@disabled.tld
comments.author: u279076@disabled.tld

comments.raw_text:
Initial state:
  the frameset => no
  upper frame  => no
  lower frame  => no
  security state => no

After I click "Link 1" in the upper frame:
  the frameset => no
  upper frame  => secure
  lower frame  => no
  security state => mixed

After I click "Link 2" in the lower frame:
  the frameset => no
  upper frame  => secure
  lower frame  => no
  security state => mixed

And, there is a comment:
http://mxr.mozilla.org/mozilla-central/source/security/manager/boot/src/nsSecureBrowserUIImpl.cpp#1376
1376     // we'll treat "broken" exactly like "insecure",
1377     // i.e. we do not show alerts when switching between broken and insecure
1378 
1379     /*
1380       from                 to           shows alert
1381     ------------------------------     ---------------
1382 
1383     no or broken -> no or broken    => <NOTHING SHOWN>
1384 
1385     no or broken -> mixed           => mixed alert
1386     no or broken -> low             => low alert
1387     no or broken -> high            => high alert
1388     
1389     mixed, high, low -> no, broken  => leaving secure
1390 
1391     mixed        -> low             => low alert
1392     mixed        -> high            => high alert
1393 
1394     high         -> low             => low alert
1395     high         -> mixed           => mixed
1396     
1397     low          -> high            => high
1398     low          -> mixed           => mixed

The testcase seems to match to the case "no or broken -> mixed" and the expected result certainly seems "mixed alert".
comments.creator: yuki@clear-code.com
comments.author: yuki@clear-code.com
comments.text:
Initial state:
  the frameset => no
  upper frame  => no
  lower frame  => no
  security state => no

After I click "Link 1" in the upper frame:
  the frameset => no
  upper frame  => secure
  lower frame  => no
  security state => mixed

After I click "Link 2" in the lower frame:
  the frameset => no
  upper frame  => secure
  lower frame  => no
  security state => mixed

And, there is a comment:
http://mxr.mozilla.org/mozilla-central/source/security/manager/boot/src/nsSecureBrowserUIImpl.cpp#1376
1376     // we'll treat "broken" exactly like "insecure",
1377     // i.e. we do not show alerts when switching between broken and insecure
1378 
1379     /*
1380       from                 to           shows alert
1381     ------------------------------     ---------------
1382 
1383     no or broken -> no or broken    => <NOTHING SHOWN>
1384 
1385     no or broken -> mixed           => mixed alert
1386     no or broken -> low             => low alert
1387     no or broken -> high            => high alert
1388     
1389     mixed, high, low -> no, broken  => leaving secure
1390 
1391     mixed        -> low             => low alert
1392     mixed        -> high            => high alert
1393 
1394     high         -> low             => low alert
1395     high         -> mixed           => mixed
1396     
1397     low          -> high            => high
1398     low          -> mixed           => mixed

The testcase seems to match to the case "no or broken -> mixed" and the expected result certainly seems "mixed alert".
